DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if BMS-232632 administered as Atazanavir/ritonavir (ATV/RTV) is superior to an anti-retroviral regimen including Lopinavir/ritonavir (LPV/RTV), as assessed by an increased brachial artery flow-mediated vasodilatation (FMD), in HIV-infected patients. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.
DOC.brief_title: A Phase IV Study of BMS-232632 in HIV+ Patients With Metabolic Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Documented Metabolic Syndrome by at least 3 of the following parameters: Abdominal obesity, assessed by waist circumference (for men >103 cm, for women >88 cm). Triglycerides > 150 mg/dl. HDL cholestrol (for men <40 mg/dl, for women <50 mg/dl). Blood pressure > or equal to 130/85 mm Hg. Fasting serum glucose > or equal to 110 mg/dl. HIV RNA < 50 copies/mL. IP within 3 months prior to selection. Treated Metabolic Syndrom
